pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [67c04c33bc](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17317/commits/67c04c33bc8b78a40e01f338c2ad06d2edea821c)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.DualNumber`|1135|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsNilpotent.not_isUnit`
`+ IsUnit.not_isNilpotent`
`+ exists_mul_left_or_mul_right`
`+ fst_eq_zero_iff_eps_dvd`
`+ fst_surjective`
`+ ideal_trichotomy`
`+ instNontrivial_of_left`
`+ instNontrivial_of_right`
`+ instance [DivisionRing K] : IsPrincipalIdealRing K[ε]`
`+ instance [DivisionRing K] : LocalRing K[ε]`
`+ isMaximal_span_singleton_eps`
`+ isNilpotent_eps`
`+ isNilpotent_iff_eps_dvd`
`+ isNilpotent_iff_isNilpotent_fst`
`+ isNilpotent_inl_iff`
`+ isNilpotent_inr`
`+ isUnit_or_isNilpotent`
`+ isUnit_or_isNilpotent_of_isMaximal_isNilpotent`
`+ maximalIdeal_eq_span_singleton_eps`
`+ snd_surjective`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
I have an almost-ready proof of `R[ε] ≃ₐ[R] (R[X] ⧸ (.span {(X ^ 2)} : Ideal R[X]))`. Would you like me to include it in this PR or separately?
Let's keep that one separate

I pushed a few golfs, please check you're happy with them.

bors d+

Thanks!

:v: pechersky can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11246189666/job/31267592577)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11246189666/job/31267592426)
I think `{x : tsze R M} : IsNilpotent x ↔ IsNilpotent x.fst` is true; the forward direction follows immediately from `fst_pow`, while the reverse should follow by doubling the exponent.
I think these can safely be instances?
Can you use `Function.Injective.nontrivial` here and below instead?
I think #12125 is more general?
Should I leave a TODO?

```suggestion
lemma isUnit_inl {r : K} (hr : r ≠ 0) :
```
surely?

```suggestion
-- TODO: delete when #12125 is merged
```
since that PR contains a more general version of this lemma already.
I hadn't thought about this. Can you get there in fewer lines by using surjectivity of fst rather than objectively of inl?
The proof of that surjectivity will require an `inhabit` also
Not if you reuse a lemma about `Prod.fst` to prove the tsze.fst version!
It is now merged, sorry for messing you around

Does casing on `IsUnit a ∨ IsNilpotent a` work here? That is, are dual numbers over local rings also local rings? Certainly the unit case is true, I haven't thought about the nilpotent case (edit: see below).

Not sure what you mean by casing on `IsUnit a ∨ IsNilpotent a` -- it's not the case that in a local ring, something is either unit or nilpotent. Counterexample: k[[X]], the ring of power series over a field, has unique maximal ideal (X) but that ideal isn't nilpotent or unit.
Can you prove this more generally for `tsze`?

This generalizes to division rings (e.g. the dual quaternions):
```lean
lemma isUnit_or_isNilpotent [DivisionRing R] [AddCommGroup M]
    [Module R M] [Module Rᵐᵒᵖ M] [SMulCommClass R Rᵐᵒᵖ M]
    (a : TrivSqZeroExt R M) :
    IsUnit a ∨ IsNilpotent a := by
  rw [isUnit_iff_isUnit_fst, isNilpotent_iff_isNilpotent_fst]
  -- TODO: this should be a more general `isUnit_or_isNilpotent` lemma for groups with zero
  obtain hz | ha := eq_or_ne a.fst 0
  · simp [hz]
  · simp [ha]
```
Can you generalize the rest accordingly?

I think this is true very generally for semirings if the same is true for the `.fst` projections; the lemmas already exist in `TrivSqZeroExt.lean` which construct the explicit left and right inverses.
I generalized to DivisionRing, which is where `Neg` and `Inv` both appear.

Ah, I meant something like
```
lemma exists_mul_left_or_mul_right (a b : tsze R M) (h : ∃ c, a.fst * c.fst = b.fst ∨ b.fst * c.fst = a.fst) :
    ∃ c, a * c = b ∨ b * c = a := by
```
which I think follows from `TrivSqZeroExt.mul_right_eq_one` and similar
Maybe the `h : ` generalization is pointless, but you should be able to generalize to `tsze R M` using those theorems to pick an inverse.

I still don't see how to prove it for `tsze` general over `M` (with plain AddCommGroup M), since one needs to somehow cancel out `b.snd` to get `a.snd` here:
```
theorem TrivSqZeroExt.extracted_1.{v, u} {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : DivisionSemiring R] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup M]
  [inst_2 : Module Rᵐᵒᵖ M] [inst_3 : Module R M] [inst_4 : SMulCommClass R Rᵐᵒᵖ M] (a b : tsze R M) (ha : a.fst = 0)
  (hb : b.fst = 0) (hb' : b.snd ≠ 0) : ∃ c, a * c = b ∨ b * c = a := sorry
```

I still don't see how to prove it for `tsze` general over `M` (with plain AddCommGroup M), since one needs to somehow cancel out `b.snd` to get `a.snd` here:
```
theorem TrivSqZeroExt.extracted_1.{v, u} {R : Type u} {M : Type v} [inst : DivisionSemiring R] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup M]
  [inst_2 : Module Rᵐᵒᵖ M] [inst_3 : Module R M] [inst_4 : SMulCommClass R Rᵐᵒᵖ M] (a b : tsze R M) (ha : a.fst = 0)
  (hb : b.fst = 0) (hb' : b.snd ≠ 0) : ∃ c, a * c = b ∨ b * c = a := sorry
```
The goal simplifies to `∃ c, a.snd <• c.fst = b.snd ∨ b.snd <• c.fst = a.snd` but there is no way to stuff the `a.snd : M` into a `c.fst`, the types don't match.
Sorry for pointing you down a dead end!

```suggestion
lemma IsUnit.not_isNilpotent [Ring R] [Nontrivial R] {x : R} (hx : IsUnit x) :
    ¬ IsNilpotent x := by
  intro H
  simpa using H.isUnit_add_right_of_commute hx.neg (by simp)

lemma IsNilpotent.not_isUnit [Ring R] [Nontrivial R] {x : R} (hx : IsNilpotent x) :
    ¬ IsUnit x :=
  mt IsUnit.not_isNilpotent (by simpa only [not_not] using hx)
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/DualNumber): dual numbers over a field are local and PIR
